pullRequest.title: Create ForbiddenBypassScanRule
pullRequest.bodyText:
Update Help.
Add CHANGELOG note.
Add UnitTests.

Signed-off-by: theamanrawat 35992750+theamanrawat@users.noreply.github.com

nodes.bodyText: These cases should be covered by the tests too.
The attack could be set to the payload sent.
To be more explicit it could be added e.g.: , the scan rule sent a payload that caused the response to be accessible (status code 200).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,3 +30,7 @@ ascanalpha.mongodb.extrainfo.alldata=In some PHP or NodeJS based back end implem
 ascanalpha.mongodb.extrainfo.sleep=Through the where or group MongoDB clauses, Javascript sleep function is probably executable.
 ascanalpha.mongodb.extrainfo.json=In some NodeJS based back end implementations, messages having the JSON format as content-type are expected. In order to obtain sensitive data it is possible to attack these applications injecting the "{$ne:}" string (or other similar ones) that is processed as an associative array rather than a simple text.\nThrough this, the queries made to MongoDB will always be true.
 ascanalpha.mongodb.extrainfo.authbypass=More probably a MongoDB attack has bypassed an authentication page.
+
+ascanalpha.forbiddenBypass.name=Bypassing 403
+ascanalpha.forbiddenBypass.desc=Bypassing 403 endpoints may be possible.

beforeCommit.message:
Create ForbiddenBypassScanRule

- Update Help.
- Add CHANGELOG note.
- Add UnitTests.

Signed-off-by: theamanrawat <35992750+theamanrawat@users.noreply.github.com>

nodes.bodyText: This is now the same case as the first if statement, better include this condition there.
Could you also assert the attack is not empty and for following tests that it's the expected one?
btw, given this is the same for all of them it could be extracted a method.
It's preferable to use specific names, e.g.shouldAlertIfOkWithRewriteUrlHeader.
Same here regarding using specific names, although this should be changed to allow to pass the header being tested.

nodes.bodyText: Should be added under the Unreleased section.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,9 @@ All notable changes to this add-on will be documented in this file.
 
 The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).
 
+### Added
+- Forbidden (403) Bypass scan rule.
+

nodes.bodyText: Note the last part, it should be changed to allow to pass the header (to avoid duplicating the same code for each header).
